docs.lead_paragraph: Craig Walker, who founded GrandCentral, which became Google Voice after he sold it, has started a new company, Firespotter Labs. The start-up, which Mr. Walker calls ''a company creation shop,'' will be a breeding ground for mobile and communications products that he hopes will become their own companies someday. Google Ventures, where Mr. Walker has been an entrepreneur in residence, is investing $3 million in Firespotter.

headline.main: Start-Up From Google Voice Creator

docs.lead_paragraph: 8:46 p.m. | Updated SAN FRANCISCO - Google took another swipe at Microsoft on Wednesday when it introduced a new kind of computer called a Chromebook, which stores everything online. Google hopes that the devices, which it says will eliminate the need for software updates and hard drive backups and will boot up within eight seconds, will replace PCs running Microsoft's Windows software in offices and homes around the world.

The animation focuses on Bukit Tigapuluh, a hilly region that provides habitat to endangered tigers, elephants, orangutans and other rare species. Camera trap footage from this area released by WWF this month showed a dozen tigers living in a logging concession. [Yale Environment 360]

docs.snippet: It's not 1999, but the big Internet I.P.O. is back.     Shares of LinkedIn, the professional social network, more than doubled on their first day of trading, a surprising debut that both echoed the giddy exuberance of the last tech boom and herald...
docs.lead_paragraph: It's not 1999, but the big Internet I.P.O. is back. Shares of LinkedIn, the professional social network, more than doubled on their first day of trading, a surprising debut that both echoed the giddy exuberance of the last tech boom and heralded the coming of several multibillion-dollar Internet companies, like Facebook, that are expected to go public in the next 12 months.

headline.main: LinkedIn Shares Soar on First Trading Day

docs.abstract: LinkedIn shares more than double on their first day trading; stock closes at $94.25 a share, giving company market value of roughly $9 billion; LinkedIN intial public offering is largest by Unites States Internet company since Google in 2004; photo (M)

docs.snippet: ''It's thrilling to feel the global reach of Newsweek, because there are very few brands left that have that kind of traction,'' Tina Brown tells The New York Times Magazine, which explores her ''queasy mystique'' in a profile. ''There's the BBC, ...
docs.lead_paragraph: ''It's thrilling to feel the global reach of Newsweek, because there are very few brands left that have that kind of traction,'' Tina Brown tells The New York Times Magazine, which explores her ''queasy mystique'' in a profile. ''There's the BBC, CNN, The New York Times, The Times of London, Time and Newsweek.'' That was probably an accurate statement last time Brown was editing a weekly magazine, in the closing years of the 20th century. But Newsweek's star has been in rapid descent since then, and now it barely cracks the list of the 100 most influential news organizations, as measured by citations of their reporting in Google and Google News. A few of the up-and-coming news outlets that have passed up Newsweek in the traction game: Bloomberg (No. 5), Al Jazeera (No. 11), Politico (No. 19), The Huffington Post (No. 37), The Milwaukee Journal-Sentinel (No. 38), Mashable (No. 59) and Us Weekly (No. 83). JEFF BERCOVICI 4:55 p.m., May 6, Mixed Media blog, Forbes.com

headline.main: Tina Brown's 'Rollicking Stuff'

docs.lead_paragraph: Shares of Yandex, a Russian search engine barely known in the United States, surged by more than 55 percent on Tuesday, signifying the latest multibillion-dollar technology offering and stoking the debate about whether this market has the makings of a bubble. docs.snippet: Q.I'm going on vacation next month and plan to ignore my e-mail. Can I make my Gmail send out a bounce message to friends saying I'll get back to them when I return?     A.Google makes it fairly easy to set up an automatic response note that bounc...
docs.lead_paragraph: Q.I'm going on vacation next month and plan to ignore my e-mail. Can I make my Gmail send out a bounce message to friends saying I'll get back to them when I return? A.Google makes it fairly easy to set up an automatic response note that bounces back when someone send a message to your Gmail account. Just log into Gmail through your Web browser and click the gear-shaped Mail Settings icon in the upper right corner of the window.

headline.main: A Vacation Reply From Gmail

docs.abstract: Personal Tech Q&A on setting a vacation, or out-of-the-office, response on G-mail. (M)

docs.snippet: Except for screen size, the first tablets on the market pretty much look alike: glass-faced slabs without much to set them apart.     On the outside, the new Google G-Slate from T-Mobile isn't much of an exception. But it does have one distinction...
docs.lead_paragraph: Except for screen size, the first tablets on the market pretty much look alike: glass-faced slabs without much to set them apart. On the outside, the new Google G-Slate from T-Mobile isn't much of an exception. But it does have one distinction: On either side of a metal strip embossed with the Google logo are a pair of camera lenses. That's right, a pair. The G-Slate takes 720p HD movies in 3-D.

headline.main: Another Tablet, but This One Shoots in 3-D

docs.abstract: Gadgetwise blog; Google G-Slate from T-Moble sets itself apart from other tablet computers by shooting 720p HD movies in 3-D; photo (M)

docs.snippet: Study casts doubt on benefit of raising good cholesterol levels, fish is frequently mislabeled, Google’s new app for paying with your phone and other consumer-focused news from The New York Times....
docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

headline.main: Friday Reading: Raising Good Cholesterol May Not Help Fight Heart Attacks

docs.abstract: Study casts doubt on benefit of raising good cholesterol levels, fish is frequently mislabeled, Google’s new app for paying with your phone and other consumer-focused news from The New York Times.

docs.snippet: Time-saving tip: All the popular web browsers will let you save a group of tabs so that your browser will open them all whenever it starts....
docs.lead_paragraph: Do you find yourself hitting the same group of Web sites every time you sit down at your computer? For me, it’s Facebook, The Times, Instapundit, Techmeme, my bank, and my Google Docs spreadsheet of freelance assignments. In fact, I open three separate Facebook tabs –- one for my messages, and two for groups in which I’m active. Most people have a similar set of pages they open over and over, several times a day.

headline.main: Setting Browser Tabs to Open at Start-Up

docs.abstract: Time-saving tip: All the popular web browsers will let you save a group of tabs so that your browser will open them all whenever it starts.
